intro: Dichaetanthera pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered dichaetanthera, is a rare flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slight pubescence. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
